event.title: 2007, about 10.7% of the population was made

data.event: As of 2007, about 10.7% of the population was made up of foreign nationals.
Most of the population (as of 2000) speaks German (94.3%), with Portuguese being second most common ( 1.3%) and Serbo-Croatian being third ( 0.8%).
Of the Swiss national languages (as of 2000), 798 speak German, 2 people speak French, 4 people speak Italian, and 3 people speak Romansh.
